title: Prysm won't connect to Witti bootnodes
body:
# üêû Bug Report
### Description

The beacon node won't connect to the public Witti bootnodes (Lighthouse, Teku, Prysm).

### Has this worked before in a previous version?

Yes. Also, Teku and Lighthouse manage to connect.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

```
bazel run //beacon-chain -- \
--witti-testnet \
--min-sync-peers 1 \
--bootstrap-node "enr:-Ku4QJsxkOibTc9FXfBWYmcdMAGwH4bnOOFb4BlTHfMdx_f0WN-u4IUqZcQVP9iuEyoxipFs7-Qd_rH_0HfyOQitc7IBh2F0dG5ldHOIAAAAAAAAAACEZXRoMpD1pf1CAAAAAP__________gmlkgnY0gmlwhLAJM9iJc2VjcDI1NmsxoQL2RyM26TKZzqnUsyycHQB4jnyg6Wi79rwLXtaZXty06YN1ZHCCW8w" \
--bootstrap-node "enr:-LK4QKTkBk3I1y4__nfX18Jdhcko2ExQzqpr8byjTB7t8HVFTLKNvipBZbPItODKWFdhBVN8vVh89ScZPdSTNoiLXXoBh2F0dG5ldHOIAAAAAAAAAACEZXRoMpD2d10HAAABE___________gmlkgnY0gmlwhLAJM9iJc2VjcDI1NmsxoQICvB04SDhZK46nvJmm6GZvo8RsKctq4uWK6jQRZBxewoN0Y3CCIyiDdWRwgiMo" \
--bootstrap-node "enr:-LK4QO-InqtcvYyJysIC8m-GimjQxeh2fMYNg557rfLD3iOtK5rZo6-1N09tw0NeIt4ht2rLtCNS6NGwU38qarXaVUMBh2F0dG5ldHOIAAAAAAAAAACEZXRoMpD2d10HAAABE___________gmlkgnY0gmlwhLAJM9iJc2VjcDI1NmsxoQISU9N1Kj03Z-IBVlevP56X9qkZxA1fv62TLRKlfzI1LYN0Y3CCMsiDdWRwgi7g" \
--bootstrap-node "enr:-KG4QOWbLS8XipfTFUjjaboBG8F4fkw7YtSSvvenmlGz6z8LeknOAxokwlhQWwiV3AftLgreD8hC94EnXdYzw93aVdQDhGV0aDKQ9nddBwAAARP__________4JpZIJ2NIJpcISwCTPYiXNlY3AyNTZrMaECLYJchUH6A-oyZenBKm5hLwIDy6xZqksxOt24irvEOEuDdGNwgnUwg3VkcIJ1MA"
```
## üî• Error

```
time="2020-06-16 14:22:45" level=info msg="Waiting for enough suitable peers before syncing" prefix=initial-sync required=1 suitable=0                                                                                                 [6/247]
time="2020-06-16 14:22:50" level=info msg="Waiting for enough suitable peers before syncing" prefix=initial-sync required=1 suitable=0
time="2020-06-16 14:22:55" level=info msg="Waiting for enough suitable peers before syncing" prefix=initial-sync required=1 suitable=0
time="2020-06-16 14:23:00" level=info msg="Waiting for enough suitable peers before syncing" prefix=initial-sync required=1 suitable=0
time="2020-06-16 14:23:05" level=info msg="Waiting for enough suitable peers before syncing" prefix=initial-sync required=1 suitable=0
time="2020-06-16 14:23:10" level=info msg="Waiting for enough suitable peers before syncing" prefix=initial-sync required=1 suitable=0
time="2020-06-16 14:23:15" level=info msg="Waiting for enough suitable peers before syncing" prefix=initial-sync required=1 suitable=0
time="2020-06-16 14:23:20" level=info msg="Waiting for enough suitable peers before syncing" prefix=initial-sync required=1 suitable=0
```

## üåç  Your Environment

**Operating System:** Arch Linux

**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)** `witti` @ 172435374d07982a8f15b0ceb042b53ce284fa7e

**Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?** ENR appears correct.

```
enr-cli --enr "enr:-Ku4QJsxkOibTc9FXfBWYmcdMAGwH4bnOOFb4BlTHfMdx_f0WN-u4IUqZcQVP9iuEyoxipFs7-Qd_rH_0HfyOQitc7IBh2F0dG5ldHOIAAAAAAAAAACEZXRoMpD1pf1CAAAAAP__________gmlkgnY0gmlwhLAJM9iJc2VjcDI1NmsxoQL2RyM26TKZzqnUsyycHQB4jnyg6Wi79rwLXtaZXty06YN1ZHCCW8w"
enr-cli --enr "enr:-LK4QKTkBk3I1y4__nfX18Jdhcko2ExQzqpr8byjTB7t8HVFTLKNvipBZbPItODKWFdhBVN8vVh89ScZPdSTNoiLXXoBh2F0dG5ldHOIAAAAAAAAAACEZXRoMpD2d10HAAABE___________gmlkgnY0gmlwhLAJM9iJc2VjcDI1NmsxoQICvB04SDhZK46nvJmm6GZvo8RsKctq4uWK6jQRZBxewoN0Y3CCIyiDdWRwgiMo"
enr-cli --enr "enr:-LK4QO-InqtcvYyJysIC8m-GimjQxeh2fMYNg557rfLD3iOtK5rZo6-1N09tw0NeIt4ht2rLtCNS6NGwU38qarXaVUMBh2F0dG5ldHOIAAAAAAAAAACEZXRoMpD2d10HAAABE___________gmlkgnY0gmlwhLAJM9iJc2VjcDI1NmsxoQISU9N1Kj03Z-IBVlevP56X9qkZxA1fv62TLRKlfzI1LYN0Y3CCMsiDdWRwgi7g"
enr-cli --enr "enr:-KG4QOWbLS8XipfTFUjjaboBG8F4fkw7YtSSvvenmlGz6z8LeknOAxokwlhQWwiV3AftLgreD8hC94EnXdYzw93aVdQDhGV0aDKQ9nddBwAAARP__________4JpZIJ2NIJpcISwCTPYiXNlY3AyNTZrMaECLYJchUH6A-oyZenBKm5hLwIDy6xZqksxOt24irvEOEuDdGNwgnUwg3VkcIJ1MA" 
ENR Read
Sequence No: 1
Node ID: 0x3ab5..1447
IP: 176.9.51.216
UDP Port: 23500
ENR Read
Sequence No: 1
Node ID: 0x2f8b..b095
IP: 176.9.51.216
TCP Port: 9000
UDP Port: 9000
ENR Read
Sequence No: 1
Node ID: 0x5bf4..9852
IP: 176.9.51.216
TCP Port: 13000
UDP Port: 12000
ENR Read
Sequence No: 3
Node ID: 0x036e..654c
IP: 176.9.51.216
TCP Port: 30000
UDP Port: 30000
```

The root cause here is we cannot reuse the `--bootstrap-node` flag and each occurrence overrides the previous one. The easy workaround is using a comma-separated list of nodes instead of providing the flag multiple times.
